snippet: At a hearing of a subcommittee on consumer protection, a corporate culture “of lawyering up” is chastised.
abstract: Editorial observes that consistent theme in emerging revelations about General Motors' deadly ignition switch has been role of company's legal department in concealing problem from public; notes that company has been strongly reprimanded by Senate subcommittee, particularly for retaining top lawyer Michael Millikin despite his role in cover-up; calls for new laws deterring such cover-ups and increasing accountability.
lead_paragraph: At a hearing of a subcommittee on consumer protection, a corporate culture “of lawyering up” is chastised.
